intro: Calandrinia biflora, commonly known as the twin-flowered portulaca, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a herbaceous annual that typically grows to a height of about 10–30 centimeters. The plant features fleshy, succulent leaves and produces small, bright red flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sunlight, often found in arid or semi-arid environments. Calandrinia biflora is valued for its ornamental appeal and drought tolerance.
